msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p:
Exhibit No. 5. B. H. C. Treasury Department, H. C. R. V. E. W. Office of the Commisoner of Internal Revenue, In correspondence on this subject quote the above initials. Washington, D.C., April 6, 1893.
American Tobacco Company, No. 45 Broadway, New York, N. Y. Gentlemen: In reply to your inquirt of April 3rd, submitting a sample package of cigarettes bearing thereon the internal revenue stamp and the printed marks and caution label, and inquiring as to the necessity for a re-enclosing in an additional covering of paper, wood or other material in placing the same upon the market; you are notified that said package, being a statutory quantity and properly stamped and cancelled and bearing thereon the caution label and the number of the manufactory, the district and state, and the number of cigarettes contained therein, meets with the approval of this bureau, being a proper and original package as contemplated by existing law and regulations.
Therefore, the re-packing of said packages in additional coverings of wood, paper, etc., is optional wih the manufacturer, and does not concern this bureau. This option if permissible unde existing regulations, Series 7, No. 8, Revised, page 46, and Internal Revenu Record, Vol. 32, page 365, dated November 22, 1886.
Respectfully yours, [Signed:] John W. Mason, Commissioner.
